documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
icians recognize that the idea of an actually infinite number of things
leads to self-contradictions. For example, what is infinity minus infinity?
Well, mathematically, you get self-contradictory answers. This shows that
infinity is just an idea in your mind, not something that exists in reality.
David Hilbert, perhaps the greatest mathematician of this century states,
“The infinite is nowhere to be found in reality. It neither exists in nature
nor provides a legitimate basis for rational thoug
